page.title: 03RAILWAY STATION WILLAND
page.content: THE RAILWAY STATION AT WILLAND IS CALLED {TIVERTON JUNCTION }IT WAS BUILT IN 1828. TODAY AN AVERAGE OF 57 TRAINS EVERY 24 HOURS PASS THROUGH THE STATION. INSIDE THE TICKET OFFICE IS ALOT OF INFORMATION ABOUT (BR) BRITISH RAILS SERVICES. THE STATION MASTER'S NAME IS ERIC AND HE IS A STEAM TRAIN FANATIC. HE GETS PAID ABOUT Â£7000 A YEAR AND HAS WORKED AT THIS STATION FOR ABOUT 7 YEARS. THE PRICE OF AN ADULT TICKET TO EXETER IS Â£1.90 FOR A CHILD 95p. THERE HAVE BEEN TWO ACCIDENTS AT STATION ONE LAST YEAR 1984. THERE IS FREQUENT TROUBLE WITH PASSENGERS. THE STATION IS NOT FIRE PROOF.{ THE STATION IS TO BE KNOCKED {DOWN IN THE NEXT YEAR. A NEW STATION {IS TO BE BUILT AT THE JUNCTION OF THE {M5 MOTORWAY AND THE NORTH DEVON LINK {ROAD TO BE CALLED TIVERTON PARKWAY. }
